Description: Conical foot sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian pottery chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black (fired red) with traces of two added white bands at bottom of foot; reserved edge of foot; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '360' is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. The foot of some Mature Animal Style chalices is decorated with concentric added white bands. For parallels, see Lemos 1991, nos 674 and 676 from Pitane. The foot of some Grand Style chalices is decorated with concentric white bands. For parallels, see Lemos 1991, no. 800 from Pitane. For parallels regarding Chalice Style chalices with painted bands around the foot, see Lemos 1991, no. 938 from Tarentum, no. 952 from Thessaloniki and no. 956 from Histria. For parallels regarding Black Figure Komast chalices with painted bands around the foot, see Lemos 1991, nos. 1562 and 1564 from Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 758, pl. XXI, no. 758)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 252, no. 4)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 682, no. 409)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0680) (phase 2)
